intro: Oenothera uncinata, commonly known as the hooked evening primrose, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Onagraceae family and is characterized by its showy yellow or orange flowers that open in the evening. The plant typically grows in dry, disturbed soils and is often found in prairies and open woodlands. Its hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves are adapted to withstand arid conditions. Oenothera uncinata is also known for its ability to produce a large number of small, hooked seeds that aid in wind dispersal.
